```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
lotr  <- read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/jennybc/lotr-tidy/master/data/lotr_tidy.csv") |> 
  rename(Species = Race)
```

1. In this data, the column headers are variable names instead of values (tidy). Each column stores only one, rather than multiple, variable (tidy).

```{r pivot wide}
(lotr_wide <- lotr |> 
  pivot_wider(id_cols = c(Film, Gender), 
              names_from = Species, 
              values_from = Words))
```

2. 
```{r pivot long}
lotr_wide |> 
  pivot_longer(cols = c(Elf:Man), 
               names_to  = "Species", 
               values_to = "Words")

```
